issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Eventhough job got FAILED, AM process still not exiting

ThreadDump of AM process is below
{noformat}
"Job Fail Wait Timeout Monitor #0" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0000000000aa9000 nid=0x41fa waiting on condition [0x00007f0e0d1d0000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000c104c688> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2043)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1079)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:807)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1068)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1130)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
fields.summary: AM JVM does not exit if MRClientService gracefull shutdown fails

comments.body: https://issues.apache.org/jira/i#browse/MAPREDUCE-5888 Linked to this JIRA

Hi [~nishan] , thanks for reporting this issue. The job would hang if MRAppMaster does not shutdown gracefully because MRClientService does not stop. Is there any exception message *Graceful stop failed* in your logs? If MRAppMaster is still running, check for the port listening.

[~rohithsharma] Yes *Graceful stop failed* log is coming in AM logs. 

MRAppMaster is listening to 2 ports
{noformat}
host-xx-xx-xx-xx:~ # netstat -tnlp | grep 22421
tcp        0      0 :::15172                :::*                    LISTEN      22421/java
tcp        0      0 :::15601                :::*                    LISTEN      22421/java
{noformat}

Attached patch for stopping clientserver at finally block.
Please review the patch..

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12664133/MAPREDUCE-6049.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:red}-1 patch{color}.  Trunk compilation may be broken.

This message is automatically generated.

[~nishan] Thanks for reporting. Can you paste the exception/error from logs when this issue occurs?

[~rohithsharma] Thanks for your contribution. If we move the *clientService.stop()* to finally, we will not be handling the shutdown error/exception instead we will be throwing to JVM. And also the exception message need to change accordingly in the catch block if we want to go with the current patch.

I think we need to add *System.exit(-1)* in catch block without modifying the existing code so that if any exception/error occurs during stop will be handled properly.
Hi [~devaraj.k]Sorry i could not attach logs since the cluster is deleted. I will try to reproduce the same
Thanks [~devaraj.k] for looking into patch. I will update patch for exiting JVM instead of calling clientRMservice in finally block.
Attached new patch that exit JVM. Please review
Clicking "Submit patch" to change status to "Patch available" and kick off jenkins.
